meanings.definition: The line or altitude above which no trees grow due to harsh environmental conditions.
meanings.sent1: Hikers reached the timberlines and saw only rocks and snow.
meanings.sent2: The timberlines on the mountain were clearly visible from a distance.
meanings.sent3: The timberlines seemed to play hide and seek with the adventurous explorers.
meanings.sent4: Above the timberlines, the landscape transformed into a barren wilderness.
meanings.sent5: The timberlines marked the boundary between lush forests and barren lands.

meanings.definition: The highest point on a mountain where trees can grow.
meanings.sent1: The climbers were thrilled to reach the timberlines and see the first trees.
meanings.sent2: Birds chirped happily at the timberlines, welcoming the travelers.
meanings.sent3: The timberlines looked like a green crown on the mountain's head.
meanings.sent4: At the timberlines, the trees stood tall like guardians of the peak.
meanings.sent5: The timberlines were a refreshing sight after the rocky ascent.
